definition[0]: to make something easier to see, taste, notice etc
example[0]: The spices really bring out the flavour of the meat.
example[1]: Fatherhood seems to have brought out the caring side of him.
definition[1]: to produce something that will be sold to the public
example[2]: He’s bringing out a new album next month.
definition[2]: to take something out of a place
example[3]: Jenny opened the cupboard and brought out a couple of bottles.
definition[3]: to make someone behave in the best or worst way that they can
example[4]: Alcohol just brings out the worst in her.
definition[4]: to make someone feel more confident and able to talk to people
example[5]: Changing schools has really brought her out of herself.
definition[5]: if a company brings out a new product, it starts producing and selling it
example[6]: Ford is set to bring out three new models this month.
